acidity.notes: Not a loud lemon note, but it's a bit puckery.

sweetness.notes: A bit of an overripe banana kind of sweet.

body.notes: Soft but more towards syrupy consistency.

finish.notes: Lemon pucker stays in mouth for a long time. Tongue and roof of mouth is dry.

flavor: Still a clean cup if it was overextracted. The lemon note is rather 'puckery' while the cup itself seems a little flat like I killed the more interesting parts of the coffee. Mouth is left feeling very dry.
notes: Used 60 grams of water to bloom, swirled generously, followed the bloom. Drawdown was very slow but never stalled. No mud in the coffee bed.
actionItem: The drawdown may have been a fluke, but try grind size 23. The dry feeling in mouth is called astringency and is similar to the feeling you get after drinking bitter black tea. Definitely overextracted.
